page.title: 04MARFORD MILL (CONT.)
page.content: In 1791 there was a terrible fire and Marford Mill was destroyed. It was then rebuilt and owned by a local family. But anyone could use the mill to grind their own corn. Marford Mill is now used as the national HQ for B.A.S.C.(British Association for Shooting and Conservation.).It is Britain's largest organisation working soley for the future of sporting shooting. The association seeks to promote the "highest standards of safety,sportmans ship and courtesy among the shooting public."
